docs.title: Mirasys Development Server Setup Guide for Non-Technical Users
What is Mirasys?
docs.text: Mirasys is our powerful application suite that helps organizations manage their video surveillance and security needs. This guide will help you understand what's needed to set up Mirasys for development and testing purposes.

docs.title: Computer Requirements Made Simple
docs.text:
To run Mirasys on your computer, you'll need:

  • Computer Type: A modern desktop or laptop (less than 5 years old)
  • Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS x86_64
  • Processor: Intel i3 or better (similar to what's found in mid-range laptops)
  • Memory: At least 20GB RAM (this ensures the system runs smoothly)
  • Storage: At least 100GB of free disk space recommended
  • Internet: A reliable internet connection (for mirasys to install and update)

docs.title: Software You'll Need
docs.text:
• Docker: This is a special program that helps run Mirasys in a controlled environment
  • Administrator Access: You'll need the password that lets you make changes to the computer

docs.title: Simple Setup Process
docs.text:
1. Make sure your computer meets the requirements above
  2. Have Docker installed on your computer (IT team manage this)
  3. Use the detailed technical guide for the actual installation steps

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Once the system is set up properly by your technical team, you'll be able to demonstrate Mirasys to clients without worrying about the technical details behind it.

For the actual installation process, please refer to the technical documentation or contact your IT department.

docs.title: 1. Clean Previous Configurations (Optional)
docs.text: rm -f .env docker-compose.yaml

docs.title: 2. Initialize Docker Images
docs.text: sudo ./deploy.sh init-images

docs.title: 3. Build and Deploy the Application
docs.text: sudo ./deploy.sh development

docs.title: 4. Host File Configuration
docs.text:
Edit the host file to map service hostnames to localhost:

sudo nano /etc/hosts

Append the following entries:

127.0.0.1 phpmyadmin_mirasys.local
127.0.0.1 mirasys_frontend_central.local
127.0.0.1 mirasys_frnt.local
127.0.0.1 mirasys_api_gateway.local
127.0.0.1 mirasys_api_tenant_gateway.local
127.0.0.1 mirasys_backend.local
127.0.0.1 mirasys_stream.local
127.0.0.1 traefik_mirasys.local
127.0.0.1 rabbitmq.local
127.0.0.1 infra.local

To save and exit:

  • Press Ctrl + X, then Y, and hit Enter.

docs.title: 5. Database Initialization
docs.text: ./create-tenant-db.sh

docs.title: Script Functionality Overview
docs.text: Function Description ls -lah /var/lib/mysql Check existing MySQL storage chown -R mysql:mysql /var/lib/mysql Ensure MySQL file ownership chmod -R 755 /var/lib/mysql Set appropriate permissions Drop mirasys, mirasys_tenant databases Clean start Create fresh databases Prepares empty DBs Run Sequelize migrations Applies schema Seed databases Loads default data Import SQL schema Setup table structure Additional tenant migrations and seeds Enable multi-tenancy Install dependencies (jq, curl) Required tools for API interaction Login to GraphQL API Retrieve access token Send authenticated alert schema setup Initializes alert system

docs.title: 6. Accessing the Application Dashboard
docs.text:
Open your browser and navigate to:

http://mirasys_frnt.local/

docs.title: 7. Troubleshooting
docs.text: Issue Solution Docker command fails Ensure user is in the docker group DB migration errors Re-run create-tenant-db.sh and check MySQL logs Services not resolving Re-check /etc/hosts configuration

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This document provides comprehensive, step-by-step instructions for installing, starting, stopping, and configuring Mirasys using the provided Bash script. It ensures a seamless setup process for both default and multi-domain installations. Additionally, it covers troubleshooting steps to resolve common issues.

docs.title: Step 1: Clone the Project
docs.text:
First, clone the repository containing the script and necessary setup files. Use the following commands:

git clone <your-repo-url>
cd <your-repo-folder>

docs.title: Step 2: Grant Execution Permissions
docs.text:
Ensure the script and its supporting scripts have the necessary permissions to execute:

chmod +x mirasys.setup.sh
chmod +x setupScript/*.sh

docs.title: Step 3: Running the Script
docs.text: The script supports multiple commands and must always be run with sudo to ensure proper execution.

docs.title: 1. Install Mirasys
docs.text:
When executing the installation command, the user is prompted to choose between a default installation.

sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh install

Installation Options

  • Default Installation (d) : o Removes existing configuration files. o Initializes Docker images. o Builds and deploys the application. o Migrates databases. o Configures the hosts file. o Ensures the application is properly set up with default settings.

docs.title: Optional Steps for Restarting the Application
docs.text: To restart the application, follow these steps. The application must be stopped (down) before starting (start) again to avoid conflicts.

docs.title: 2. Start Mirasys (Optional, for restarting the application)
docs.text:
sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh start

This command starts Mirasys using the deployment script, ensuring that all required services are properly initialized.

docs.title: 3. Stop Mirasys (Optional, but necessary before restarting)
docs.text:
sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh down

This command stops Mirasys gracefully, ensuring that all services are shut down properly before a restart.

docs.title: 4. Configure Mirasys Hosts (Optional, to ensure correct network
settings)
docs.text:
sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh hostConfig

This applies necessary host configurations, updating the system’s /etc/hosts file with the required entries.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: If issues arise during installation, deployment, or operation, refer to the following troubleshooting steps.

docs.title: Issues Related to Host Configuration
docs.text:
• If the host configuration does not apply correctly, ensure you have the necessary permissions to modify /etc/hosts.
  • Run the following command to manually check the hosts file: cat /etc/hosts
  • If necessary, rerun the host configuration script: sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh hostConfig

docs.title: General Issues and Fixes
docs.text:
• Permission Errors: If you encounter permission-related errors, make sure the script is always run with sudo: sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh
  • Missing Dependencies: Ensure that all required dependencies (such as Docker and Git) are installed before executing the script.
  • Script Execution Failure: If any script fails during execution, check the logs for detailed error messages and take appropriate action.

docs.title: Contact Support
docs.text: For further assistance, reach out to your system administrator or the official support team.

docs.title: 1. Overview
docs.text: This document provides step-by-step instructions for setting up the Mirasys application in a local development environment on Ubuntu using Docker.

docs.title: 2. System Requirements
docs.text: Requirement Details Operating System Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS x86_64 Docker Must be installed User Permissions Sudo (administrator) privileges required Internet Access Required to download images and packages

docs.title: 3. Check System Requirements
docs.text:
To check if your system meets the requirements, run the following commands:

grep -o -w 'sse3\|ssse3\|sse4_1\|sse4_2\|popcnt\|cx16\|lahf_lm' /proc/cpuinfo | sort | uniq
🟢 Output example if compatible: 
cx16
lahf_lm
popcnt
sse4_1
sse4_2
ssse3

docs.title: 4. Docker Installation (Ubuntu)
docs.text:
To install Docker, run the following commands:

sudo apt update && sudo apt install apt-transport-https ca-certificates curl software-properties-common

curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg

echo "deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] \
https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | \
sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

sudo apt update && sudo apt install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io && sudo groupadd docker && sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

Note: Log out and log back in to apply group changes.

To verify Docker installation:

sudo systemctl status docker

docs.title: 5. Application Setup
docs.text:
Clone the Mirasys repository using one of the following commands:

# Clone with specific branch
git clone <YOUR_GIT_REPOSITORY_LINK> -b <BRANCH_NAME>

# Clone default branch
git clone <YOUR_GIT_REPOSITORY_LINK>

docs.title: 6. Permission Setup
docs.text:
After cloning the repository, navigate to the project directory and set the necessary permissions:

chmod +x mirasys.setup.sh && \
chmod +x setupScript/*.sh && \
chmod +x troubleshoot-system/*.sh

docs.title: Mirasys Environment Package
docs.text: A comprehensive Debian package designed to streamline the setup and configuration of the Mirasys operational environment.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Mirasys Environment Package provides a standardized, ready-to-use environment for all Mirasys systems and applications. This package:

  • Automatically configures system settings for optimal Mirasys application performance
  • Installs and manages all necessary dependencies
  • Sets up required system services and configurations
  • Ensures consistent environments across different deployments
  • Simplifies the installation and maintenance process

By using this package, system administrators can ensure that all Mirasys applications run in a properly configured environment, reducing setup errors and improving operational reliability.

docs.title: Version
docs.text:
Current version: 1.0.0

Release date: May 23, 2025

Key features in this version: - Initial stable release with core environment configurations - Support for all current Mirasys applications - Automated dependency management - System optimization for Mirasys workloads

docs.title: From Remote Repository
docs.text:
To install the Mirasys Environment Package, follow these simple steps:

Step 1: Download the latest release package from our remote repository:

# Download the package
wget https://bitbucket.org/supratimneogi007/syncmaster/downloads/mirasys-env_1.0.0_all.deb

Step 2: Install the package using the Debian package manager:

# Install directly
sudo dpkg -i mirasys-env_1.0.0_all.deb

# If dependencies need to be resolved
sudo apt install -f

Step 3: Verify the installation was successful:

# Check installation status
sudo dpkg -s mirasys-env | grep Status

You should see output confirming that the package is installed and properly configured.

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
• Ubuntu 18.04 LTS or later / Debian 10 or later
  • Minimum 2GB RAM (4GB recommended)
  • 500MB free disk space
  • Internet connection (for dependency installation)
  • Root or sudo privileges

docs.title: Pre-Installation
docs.text:
Before installing the Mirasys Environment Package, ensure that your system meets the following requirements:

  1. Supported Operating Systems:

    • Ubuntu 18.04 LTS or later
    • Debian 10 or later

  2. Hardware Requirements:

    • Minimum 2GB RAM (4GB recommended)
    • 500MB free disk space

  3. Network Requirements:

    • Internet connection (for dependency installation)

  4. User Permissions:

    • Root or sudo privileges

docs.title: Post-Installation
docs.text:
After installation, the system is automatically configured and ready to run Mirasys applications. No additional setup is required.

To check the environment configuration:

mirasys-env

docs.title: Multi-Domain Mirasys Setup
docs.text: This guide helps you configure the Mirasys application with support for multiple custom domain names and ports.

docs.title: 1. Get the Project Files
docs.text:
Clone the project repository:

git clone <project_repository_link>

docs.title: 2. Update Configuration (app.env.dev)
docs.text:
Update the following keys in your app.env.dev file to reflect your custom domain and port setup:

# Environment configuration for Docker Compose
#=============================================

# Domain and port configuration
DOMAIN=nagpur.mirasys.com
STATIC_PORT=8041
PREFIX=nagpur

# Service URLs
PMA_URL=phpmyadmin.${DOMAIN}
MIRASYS_FRNT_CENT_URL=frontend-central.${DOMAIN}
MIRASYS_FRNT_URL=${DOMAIN}
MIRASYS_FRNT_NEW_URL=frontend-new.demo.${DOMAIN}
MIRASYS_API_GATEWAY_URL=api-gateway.${DOMAIN}
MIRASYS_API_TENANT_GATEWAY_URL=tenant-apigateway.${DOMAIN}
MIRASYS_BACKEND_URL=backend.${DOMAIN}
MIRASYS_STREAM_URL=stream.${DOMAIN}
TRAEFIK_URL=traefik.${DOMAIN}
RABBITMQ_URL=rabbitmq.${DOMAIN}
INFRA_URL=infra.${DOMAIN}

# Database configuration
MASTER_DATABASE=nagpur_mirasys_master
ROOT_PASSWORD=ows@123
DATABASE_NAME=nagpur_mirasys_tenant

# JWT configuration
JWT_SECRET=<your_jwt_secret>
JWT_EXPIRES_IN=14d

# Frontend Central configuration
#==============================
REACT_APP_API_URL_CENTRAL=http://${MIRASYS_API_GATEWAY_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}/graphql

# Frontend Tenant configuration
#==============================
REACT_APP_API_URL=http://${MIRASYS_API_TENANT_GATEWAY_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}/graphql
REACT_APP_API_BASE_URL=http://${MIRASYS_API_TENANT_GATEWAY_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}/api/v1
REACT_APP_IMAGE_URL=http://${MIRASYS_API_TENANT_GATEWAY_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}/uploads
REACT_APP_GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY=<your_google_map_api_key>
REACT_APP_API_SOCKET_URL=http://${MIRASYS_API_TENANT_GATEWAY_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}
REACT_APP_STREAM_URL=http://${MIRASYS_STREAM_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}
REACT_APP_OPEN_STREET_API_KEY=<your_open_street_api_key>

# API Central configuration
#==============================
CN_PORT=4001
CN_DBUSERNAME=root
CN_DBPASSWORD=${ROOT_PASSWORD}
CN_DBDATABASE=${DATABASE_NAME}
CN_DBHOST=db
CN_CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME=root
CN_CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD=${ROOT_PASSWORD}
CN_CENTRAL_DB_NAME=${MASTER_DATABASE}
CN_CENTRAL_DBHOST=db
CN_FRONT_END_URL=${MIRASYS_FRNT_CENT_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}
CN_MAIL_DRIVER=smtp
CN_MAIL_HOST=smtp.gmail.com
CN_MAIL_PORT=587
CN_MAIL_USERNAME=wellsyntest@gmail.com
CN_MAIL_PASSWORD=onxdxumdzwuztipe
CN_MAIL_ENCRYPTION=tls
CN_MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=wellsyntest@gmail.com
CN_MAIL_FROM_NAME=Welldom TheraSync
CN_EXISTING_API_URL=http://mirasys_backend:3001

# API Tenant configuration
#==============================
TT_PORT=4001
TT_DBUSERNAME=root
TT_DBPASSWORD=${ROOT_PASSWORD}
TT_DBDATABASE=${DATABASE_NAME}
TT_DBHOST=db
TT_CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME=root
TT_CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD=${ROOT_PASSWORD}
TT_CENTRAL_DB_NAME=${MASTER_DATABASE}
TT_CENTRAL_DBHOST=db
TT_FRONT_END_URL=${MIRASYS_FRNT_URL}:${STATIC_PORT}
TT_MAIL_DRIVER=smtp
TT_MAIL_HOST=smtp.gmail.com
TT_MAIL_PORT=587
TT_MAIL_USERNAME=wellsyntest@gmail.com
TT_MAIL_PASSWORD=onxdxumdzwuztipe
TT_MAIL_ENCRYPTION=tls
TT_MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=wellsyntest@gmail.com
TT_MAIL_FROM_NAME=Welldom TheraSync
TT_EXISTING_API_URL=http://mirasys_backend:3001
TT_API_SERVER_URL=http://${MIRASYS_API_TENANT_GATEWAY_URL}
TT_UPLOAD_IMAGE_URL=http://mirasys_api_tenant_gateway:4001/uploads
TT_VS_INFO_URL=http://172.18.0.1:6554/startvs

# Backend configuration
#==============================
BE_PORT=3001
BE_MYSQL_USER=root
BE_MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=${ROOT_PASSWORD}
BE_MYSQL_DATABASE=${DATABASE_NAME}
BE_MYSQL_LOCAL_PORT=3306
BE_CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME=root
BE_CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD=${ROOT_PASSWORD}
BE_CENTRAL_DB_NAME=${MASTER_DATABASE}
BE_CENTRAL_DBHOST=db
BE_MYSQL_HOST=db
BE_APP_URL=${MIRASYS_BACKEND_URL}

# elasticsearch configuration URLs
ELASTICSEARCH_URL=http://${PREFIX}_elasticsearch:9200

docs.title: 3. Edit Docker Configuration (docker-compose.local.yaml)
docs.text:
Update the container names and port settings:

version: "4.2.5"

# Define a reusable network configuration
x-mirasys-network: &mirasys-network
  networks:
    - mirasys-network

services:
  {{C_PREFIX}}_traefik:
    image: traefik:v3.0.0-beta5
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_traefik_mirasys
    restart: unless-stopped
    command:
      - "--log.level=DEBUG"
      - "--api.insecure=true"
      - "--providers.docker=true"
      - "--providers.docker.exposedbydefault=false"
    ports:
      - "{{STATIC_PORT}}:80"
      - "{{TRAEFIK_PORT}}:8080"
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    depends_on:
      - "phpmyadmin"
      - "{{C_PREFIX}}_infra"
      - "{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_gateway"
      - "{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frontend_central"
      - "{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frnt"
      - "{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_backend"
      - "rabbitmq"
      - "{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_streaming"
      - "{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_tenant_gateway"
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_traefik.rule=Host(`${TRAEFIK_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_traefik.service=api@internal"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_traefik.middlewares=traefik-auth"
      - "traefik.http.middlewares.traefik-auth.basicauth.users=systemteam:$2a$10$1kocyz5oVBUYlojfFDatPeYgpyx8yM6ATVj/W2yE/E/fLTlRlXYSe"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_infra:
    build:
      context: ./infra
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_infra
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - db
    links:
      - db
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - ./infra:/app
      - ./mirasys_frnt:/mirasys_frnt
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.${C_PREFIX}_infra.rule=Host(`${INFRA_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.${C_PREFIX}_infra.loadbalancer.server.port=5000"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_gateway:
    build:
      context: ./mirasys_api_gateway/
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_gateway
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - db
    links:
      - db
      - rabbitmq
      - {{C_PREFIX}}_infra
    volumes:
      - ./mirasys_api_gateway:/app
    environment:
      - PORT=${CN_PORT}
      - DBUSERNAME=${CN_DBUSERNAME}
      - DBPASSWORD=${CN_DBPASSWORD}
      - DBDATABASE=${CN_DBDATABASE}
      - DBHOST=${CN_DBHOST}
      - CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME=${CN_CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME}
      - CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD=${CN_CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD}
      - CENTRAL_DB_NAME=${CN_CENTRAL_DB_NAME}
      - CENTRAL_DBHOST=${CN_CENTRAL_DBHOST}
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
      - JWT_EXPIRES_IN=${JWT_EXPIRES_IN}
      - FRONT_END_URL=${CN_FRONT_END_URL}
      - MAIL_DRIVER=${CN_MAIL_DRIVER}
      - MAIL_HOST=${CN_MAIL_HOST}
      - MAIL_PORT=${CN_MAIL_PORT}
      - MAIL_USERNAME=${CN_MAIL_USERNAME}
      - MAIL_PASSWORD=${CN_MAIL_PASSWORD}
      - MAIL_ENCRYPTION=${CN_MAIL_ENCRYPTION}
      - MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=${CN_MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS}
      - MAIL_FROM_NAME=${CN_MAIL_FROM_NAME}
      - EXISTING_API_URL=${CN_EXISTING_API_URL}
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_gateway.rule=Host(`${MIRASYS_API_GATEWAY_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_gateway.loadbalancer.server.port=4001"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_tenant_gateway:
    build:
      context: ./mirasys_api_tenant_gateway/
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_tenant_gateway
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - db
      - mongo
    links:
      - db
      - rabbitmq
      - {{C_PREFIX}}_infra
    volumes:
      - ./mirasys_api_tenant_gateway:/app
    environment:
      - PORT=${TT_PORT}
      - DBUSERNAME=${TT_DBUSERNAME}
      - DBPASSWORD=${TT_DBPASSWORD}
      - DBDATABASE=${TT_DBDATABASE}
      - DBHOST=${TT_DBHOST}
      - CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME=${TT_CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME}
      - CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD=${TT_CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD}
      - CENTRAL_DB_NAME=${TT_CENTRAL_DB_NAME}
      - CENTRAL_DBHOST=${TT_CENTRAL_DBHOST}
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
      - JWT_EXPIRES_IN=${JWT_EXPIRES_IN}
      - FRONT_END_URL=${TT_FRONT_END_URL}
      - MAIL_DRIVER=${TT_MAIL_DRIVER}
      - MAIL_HOST=${TT_MAIL_HOST}
      - MAIL_PORT=${TT_MAIL_PORT}
      - MAIL_USERNAME=${TT_MAIL_USERNAME}
      - MAIL_PASSWORD=${TT_MAIL_PASSWORD}
      - MAIL_ENCRYPTION=${TT_MAIL_ENCRYPTION}
      - MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=${TT_MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS}
      - MAIL_FROM_NAME=${TT_MAIL_FROM_NAME}
      - EXISTING_API_URL=${TT_EXISTING_API_URL}
      - API_SERVER_URL=${TT_API_SERVER_URL}
      - UPLOAD_IMAGE_URL=${TT_UPLOAD_IMAGE_URL}
      - VS_INFO_URL=${TT_VS_INFO_URL}
      - ELASTICSEARCH_URL=${ELASTICSEARCH_URL}
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_tenant_gateway.rule=Host(`${MIRASYS_API_TENANT_GATEWAY_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_api_tenant_gateway.loadbalancer.server.port=4001"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frnt:
    build:
      context: ./mirasys_frnt/
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frnt
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - db
    links:
      - db
      - rabbitmq
      - {{C_PREFIX}}_infra
    volumes:
      - ./mirasys_frnt:/app
    environment:
      - REACT_APP_API_URL=${REACT_APP_API_URL}
      - REACT_APP_API_BASE_URL=${REACT_APP_API_BASE_URL}
      - REACT_APP_IMAGE_URL=${REACT_APP_IMAGE_URL}
      - REACT_APP_GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY=${REACT_APP_GOOGLE_MAP_API_KEY}
      - REACT_APP_API_SOCKET_URL=${REACT_APP_API_SOCKET_URL}
      - REACT_APP_STREAM_URL=${REACT_APP_STREAM_URL}
      - REACT_APP_OPEN_STREET_API_KEY=${REACT_APP_OPEN_STREET_API_KEY}
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frnt.rule=Host(`${MIRASYS_FRNT_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frnt.loadbalancer.server.port=3000"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frontend_central:
    build:
      context: ./mirasys_frontend_central/
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frontend_central
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - db
    links:
      - db
      - rabbitmq
      - {{C_PREFIX}}_infra
    volumes:
      - ./mirasys_frontend_central:/app
    environment:
      - REACT_APP_API_URL_CENTRAL=${REACT_APP_API_URL_CENTRAL}
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frontend_central.rule=Host(`${MIRASYS_FRNT_CENT_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_frontend_central.loadbalancer.server.port=3000"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_backend:
    build:
      context: ./mirasys_backend/
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_backend
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - db
    links:
      - db
      - rabbitmq
      - {{C_PREFIX}}_infra
    volumes:
      - ./mirasys_backend:/app
    environment:
      - PORT=${BE_PORT}
      - MYSQL_USER=${BE_MYSQL_USER}
      - MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=${BE_MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD}
      - MYSQL_DATABASE=${BE_MYSQL_DATABASE}
      - MYSQL_LOCAL_PORT=${BE_MYSQL_LOCAL_PORT}
      - DBHOST=${BE_DBHOST}
      - CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME=${BE_CENTRAL_DB_USERNAME}
      - CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD=${BE_CENTRAL_DB_PASSWORD}
      - CENTRAL_DB_NAME=${BE_CENTRAL_DB_NAME}
      - CENTRAL_DBHOST=${BE_CENTRAL_DBHOST}
      - APP_URL=${BE_APP_URL}
      - MYSQL_HOST=${BE_MYSQL_HOST}
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
      - JWT_EXPIRES_IN=${JWT_EXPIRES_IN}
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_backend.rule=Host(`${MIRASYS_BACKEND_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_backend.loadbalancer.server.port=3001"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_streaming:
    build:
      context: ./mirasys_streaming/
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_streaming
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - db
    links:
      - db
      - rabbitmq
      - {{C_PREFIX}}_infra
    volumes:
      - ./mirasys_streaming:/app
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_streaming.rule=Host(`${MIRASYS_STREAM_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.{{C_PREFIX}}_mirasys_streaming.loadbalancer.server.port=2001"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  db:
    image: mysql:8.0
    container_name: db
    restart: unless-stopped
    tty: true
    environment:
      MYSQL_DATABASE: ${MASTER_DATABASE}
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${ROOT_PASSWORD}
    volumes:
      - dbdata:/var/lib/mysql/
    networks:
      - mirasys-network

  rabbitmq:
    image: rabbitmq:3-management
    container_name: rabbitmq
    environment:
      - RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER=ows
      - RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS=ows@123
    restart: always
    volumes:
      - rabbitmq:/var/lib/rabbitmq/
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.rabbitmq.rule=Host(`${RABBITMQ_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.rabbitmq.loadbalancer.server.port=15672"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  phpmyadmin:
    image: phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin
    container_name: pma
    links:
      - db
    environment:
      PMA_HOST: db
      PMA_PORT: 3306
      PMA_ARBITRARY: 1
      UPLOAD_LIMIT: 1024M
      MAX_EXECUTION_TIME: 259200
      MAX_INPUT_TIME: 259200
      UPLOAD_MAX_FILE_SIZE: 750M
      POST_MAX_SIZE: 750M
    restart: always
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.phpmyadmin.rule=Host(`${PMA_URL}`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.phpmyadmin.loadbalancer.server.port=80"
    <<: *mirasys-network

  mongo:
    image: mongo:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    container_name: mongo
    environment:
      MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME: root
      MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${ROOT_PASSWORD}
    volumes:
      - mongodata:/data/db
    <<: *mirasys-network

  redis:
    image: redis:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    container_name: redis
    volumes:
      - redisdata:/data
    <<: *mirasys-network

  {{C_PREFIX}}_elasticsearch:
    image: elasticsearch:8.17.4
    restart: unless-stopped
    container_name: {{C_PREFIX}}_elasticsearch
    environment:
      - discovery.type=single-node
      - xpack.security.enabled=false
    volumes:
      - elasticsearchdata:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 4G # Adjust this according to your system
        reservations:
          memory: 2G
    <<: *mirasys-network

volumes:
  dbdata:
  rabbitmq:
  mongodata:
  redisdata:
  elasticsearchdata:

networks:
  mirasys-network:
    external: true

Note: Make sure to replace {{C_PREFIX}} with your desired prefix for the containers. Ensure that the docker-compose.dev.yaml file is correctly configured with the necessary environment variables and paths.

docs.title: 4. Deploy the Project
docs.text:
sudo ./deploy.sh init-images && \
sudo ./deploy.sh development

docs.title: 5. Configure the Host File
docs.text:
sudo nano /etc/hosts

Add the following:

127.0.0.1 phpmyadmin.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 frontend-central.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 api-gateway.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 tenant-api-gateway.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 backend.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 stream.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 traefik.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 rabbitmq.demo.mirasys.in
127.0.0.1 infra.demo.mirasys.in

Press CTRL+X, then Y, then ENTER to save.

docs.title: 6. Set Up the Database
docs.text:
sudo ./create-tenant-db.sh

✅ Setup Completed!

Your Mirasys system is now ready with multiple domain support.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This document provides comprehensive, step-by-step instructions for installing, starting, stopping, and configuring Mirasys using the provided Bash script. It ensures a seamless setup process for both default and multi-domain installations. Additionally, it covers troubleshooting steps to resolve common issues.

docs.title: Step 1: Clone the Project
docs.text:
First, clone the repository containing the script and necessary setup files. Use the following commands:

git clone <your-repo-url>
cd <your-repo-folder>

docs.title: Step 2: Grant Execution Permissions
docs.text:
Ensure the script and its supporting scripts have the necessary permissions to execute:

chmod +x mirasys.setup.sh
chmod +x setupScript/*.sh

docs.title: Step 3: Running the Script
docs.text: The script supports multiple commands and must always be run with sudo to ensure proper execution.

docs.title: 1. Install Mirasys
docs.text:
When executing the installation command, the user is prompted to choose between a multi-domain installation.

sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh install

Installation Options

  • Multi-Domain Installation (m) : o Deletes existing configuration files before generating new ones. o Dynamically generates configuration files based on user input: ▪ The script asks for essential details, including the domain name, static port, database names, root password, Traefik port, and container prefix. ▪ These inputs are used to populate template files (app.env.domain, docker-compose.domain.yaml) with the correct values. ▪ Verifies that all generated configuration files are accurate before proceeding with deployment. o Deploys necessary services and initializes relevant database settings. o Configures host settings to ensure smooth multi-domain operation.

User Input Prompts

During multi-domain installation, the user will be prompted to provide various configuration details, which will be used to generate the required configuration files:

  • Enter DOMAIN: example.com

  • Enter Static Port: 8080

  • Enter Master Database Name: mirasys_master
  • Enter Database Name: mirasys_db
  • Enter Root Password: **
  • Enter Traefik Port: 9090
  • Enter Container Prefix: mirasys

The provided information is crucial for configuring the system correctly, ensuring smooth operation and deployment.

docs.title: Optional Steps for Restarting the Application
docs.text: To restart the application, follow these steps. The application must be stopped (down) before starting (start) again to avoid conflicts.

docs.title: 2. Start Mirasys (Optional, for restarting the application)
docs.text:
sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh start

This command starts Mirasys using the deployment script, ensuring that all required services are properly initialized.

docs.title: 3. Stop Mirasys (Optional, but necessary before restarting)
docs.text:
sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh down

This command stops Mirasys gracefully, ensuring that all services are shut down properly before a restart.

docs.title: 4. Configure Mirasys Hosts (Optional, to ensure correct network
settings)
docs.text:
sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh hostConfig

This applies necessary host configurations, updating the system’s /etc/hosts file with the required entries.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: If issues arise during installation, deployment, or operation, refer to the following troubleshooting steps.

docs.title: Issues Related to Host Configuration
docs.text:
• If the host configuration does not apply correctly, ensure you have the necessary permissions to modify /etc/hosts.
  • Run the following command to manually check the hosts file: cat /etc/hosts
  • If necessary, rerun the host configuration script: sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh hostConfig

docs.title: General Issues and Fixes
docs.text:
• Permission Errors: If you encounter permission-related errors, make sure the script is always run with sudo: sudo ./mirasys.setup.sh
  • Missing Dependencies: Ensure that all required dependencies (such as Docker and Git) are installed before executing the script.
  • Script Execution Failure: If any script fails during execution, check the logs for detailed error messages and take appropriate action.

docs.title: Contact Support
docs.text: For further assistance, reach out to your system administrator or the official support team.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The troubleshoot-system is an interactive command-line tool designed to help diagnose and resolve common system issues within the Mirasys infrastructure. This tool provides categorized solutions for various error types and maintains a troubleshooting history log.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
troubleshoot-system/
├── modules/              # Contains specialized troubleshooting modules
│   ├── common_utils.sh
│   ├── analytics_errors.sh
│   ├── application_errors.sh
│   ├── update_analytics_errors.sh
│   ├── alerts.sh
│   └── mysql_permission_errors.sh
├── solutions/            # Contains solution files for specific issues
├── logs/                 # Stores troubleshooting history logs
└── troubleshoot.sh       # Main script

docs.title: Running the Script
docs.text:
Navigate to the troubleshoot-system directory and run the main script:

cd /path/to/troubleshoot-system
bash troubleshoot.sh

docs.title: Using the Tool
docs.text: The tool provides a menu-driven interface with color-coded options for better readability:

docs.title: Main Menu
docs.text:
When you start the tool, you'll see the main menu with these categories:

  1. Analytics Errors - For troubleshooting issues related to analytics functionality
  2. Application Errors - For diagnosing general application issues
  3. Alerts - For handling system alerts and notifications
  4. MySql Permissions Issue - For resolving database permission problems
  5. View Troubleshooting History - To review past troubleshooting actions
  6. Exit - To quit the tool

docs.title: Workflow
docs.text:
1. Select a category by entering the corresponding number
  2. Follow the sub-menu options to identify your specific issue
  3. The system will display relevant solutions or guide you through the troubleshooting process
  4. All actions are automatically logged for future reference

docs.title: 1. Analytics Errors
docs.text: This section addresses issues specific to the analytics system, such as: - "Unknown error Analytics.is_challan in field list" - Data processing failures - Report generation problems

docs.title: 2. Application Errors
docs.text: Common application errors that might occur in the Mirasys environment, including: - Runtime exceptions - Configuration issues - Service connectivity problems

docs.title: 3. Alerts
docs.text: Tools for managing and responding to system alerts: - Alert acknowledgment - Alert investigation workflows - False positive handling

docs.title: 4. MySQL Permissions Issues
docs.text: Specialized solutions for database permission problems: - Access denied errors - Privilege escalation workflows - User permission management

docs.title: Troubleshooting History
docs.text:
The system maintains a detailed log of all troubleshooting actions in the logs/troubleshoot_history.log file. Each entry includes: - Timestamp of the action - Selected troubleshooting category and option - Actions performed

You can view this history directly through the main menu by selecting option h.

docs.title: Extending the Tool
docs.text:
The modular structure allows for easy extension:

  1. Add new module files to the modules/ directory
  2. Source them in the main script
  3. Add corresponding menu options

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Always check the troubleshooting history before attempting to solve a recurring issue
  2. Follow the suggested solutions precisely
  3. Document any additional steps you took that weren't covered by the tool
  4. Report any new issues that should be added to the tool

docs.title: Video Tutorials
docs.text: Your browser does not support the video tag.
